Texto: 
sagittal t1-weighted images demonstrate a hypointense region involving the inferior aspect of the right cerebellum.  t2-weighted images show hyperintense signal involving the right cerebellum with extension into the right medulla.  diffusion-weighted imaging shows high signal consistent with restricted diffusion in the area of t2 hyperintensity.  this is confirmed on adc mapping images.
posterior inferior cerebellar artery infarct
79 y/o wf complains of "falling to the right" x 2 weeks and found to have nystagmus on physical exam
see factoid
